answers.answer: Are you drinking enough water?  Are you on your feet all day?  If you are worry, place a call to your ob.

I would go in and get checked. The pre-eclampsia can come on suddenly. You don't want to chance it. My sister in law was fine and it hit right at 30 weeks and they had to take the babies. They are fine and healthy now.

I will be 30 weeks Wend.  and my feet have been swollen since around 22 weeks.  My dr says its normal since I stand all day.  I drink plenty of water and dont eat much salt.  It dont hurt, my feet just look huge!
I would call the dr and try to be seen. it may be nothing but I would check anyway the above post is right about preeclampsia

It's of more concern if the swelling is involving your hands and face, too.  Or if your swelling has come up very suddenly.  Any headaches, blurred vision?I'd see if you could get in to your doc this week for a quick check.

question: I was just wondering if anyone wanted to give any advice. I am 29 weeks and 5 days and for the past 3 days my feet have been so swollen and I have been having belly pains above my uterus. My feet aren't sore and I they don't feel tired. I also haven't had that much sodium intake so I don't think its that. It never really goes away, it's there in the morning and there when I go to bed. I just had my 28 week check up like 2 weeks ago and I do not go back for almost another 2 weeks. All my test have come back normal for blood work and blood sugar and anemia. So, the question is should I call them and ask to come in earlier? Second question, could something have happened in this short time (2 weeks) like hypertension or toxemia that I don't know about and without any warning signs during my last appointment?
title: 29/30 weeeks and severely swollen
